---
title: "create map"
---

Create map for Japan Typhoon data from 1951 to 2023.

::: {.column-screen}


# import modules 
```{python}
import polars as pl
pl.Config.set_tbl_rows(7)   # limit num of lines for table preview
import plotly.express as px

print('polars:', pl.__version__)
```


# read df parquet 
```{python}
%time

df_parquet_f_path = "./data/processed/df.parquet"
df = pl.read_parquet(df_parquet_f_path)
print('read df as parquet')
df
```


# filter data by year range
```{python}
year_range = [2022, 2023]

df_filtered = df.filter(
    pl.col('date_time')
      .dt.year()
      .is_between(year_range[0], year_range[1])
)
print('df filtered by year range:')
df_filtered
```


# create map 
```{python}
fig = px.line_mapbox(
    df_filtered,
    # lat=df_filtered["d_d_latitude"],
    # lon=df_filtered["d_e_longitude"],
    lat="d_d_latitude",
    lon="d_e_longitude",
    color="h_b_int_num_id",
    zoom=3,
    height=1000,
    # animation_frame="h_b_int_num_id"
)

fig.update_layout(
    # mapbox_style="open-street-map",
    mapbox_style="carto-darkmatter",
    # mapbox_zoom=4,
    mapbox_center_lat=36,
    margin={"r":0,"t":0,"l":0,"b":0},
)

fig.show()
```


:::
